Question:
During the first four sets of a volleyball match, when are the two technical time-outs automatically taken? 
A) When the leading team reaches the 5th and 10th points 
B) When the leading team reaches the 6th and 12th points 
C) When the leading team reaches the 8th and 16th points 
D) When the leading team reaches the 7th and 14th points

In volleyball, a double-double involving kills and digs is typically achieved by which type of players?
A) Setters
B) Liberos
C) Hitters
D) Defensive specialists

Block signals in beach volleyball are made: 
A) In front of the player's body 
B) Behind the player's back 
C) Above the player's head 
D) At the player's side

When a beach volleyball blocker shows a closed fist signal, what should they NOT attempt? 
A) A block on the opponent's angle hit 
B) A block on the opponent's line hit 
C) Any block on that side of the court 
D) A spread block

Can a team make substitutions or replacements during a beach volleyball match?
A) Yes, unlimited substitutions 
B) Yes, but only one substitution 
C) No substitutions or replacements 
D) Yes, but only at certain times
